thread.title: One Bulldog headed to NFL Combine
thread.title_full: One Bulldog headed to NFL Combine

title: One Bulldog headed to NFL Combine
text:
One Bulldog headed to NFL Combine The official list for the NFL Combine has been released where only one Bulldog will take part. Slot to Georgia Links 
The NFL has released it's official list for the combine and Georgia will have one representative. Wide receiver and return specialist Isaiah McKenzie will be the only Bulldog to take part in the event early next month. 
The 5-foot-7, 175-pound playmaker is coming off the best season of his college career after 44 receptions for 633 yards and seven touchdowns as a junior. The only Bulldogs junior to declare early for the draft, McKenzie was the Bulldogs' leading receiver in all three categories for 2016. Not a member? For a limited time, buy one month of Dawgs247 VIP, get two months FREE! 
He's was a record-setting return man at UGA. McKenzie's four punter returns for a score is a Bulldog record as are his five total returns for a score. 
The fact that UGA has only one player invited to the combine is much different than years past where Bulldogs have had multiple representatives. Players will take part in a variety of athletic tests such as the 40-yard dash, 20-yard shuttle, three-cone drill, and triple jump as well as position drills. 
(What's next for the Bulldogs? Make sure you're in the loop -- take a few moments to sign up for our FREE Bulldogs Newsletter! ) Author
